name: Rosary
mdText: Pope Benedict XVI on the mysteries of the rosary

rosaryMysteries.title: The Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin Mary
The Visitation of the Blessed Virgin Mary to Saint Elizabeth
The Nativity of the Lord Jesus
The Presentation of the Lord Jesus in the Temple
The Finding of the Lord Jesus in the Temple
The Baptism of the Lord Jesus in the Jordan
rosaryMysteries.mdText: Faith confession is not a sum of sentences, it is not just a theory. Its roots lie in the event of baptism, in the event of meeting God with man. In the mystery of baptism, God bends over us – people, meets us, and thus makes us closer to each other. In this way, he creates one big family in the universal community of the Church.

rosaryMysteries.title: The Miracle at Cana
rosaryMysteries.mdText: Love is possible and we can realize it because we are created in the image of God. Let us pray for each other, so that Christ may carry us on his shoulders and that we may learn to carry each other.

rosaryMysteries.title: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God and the Call to Conversion
rosaryMysteries.mdText: We continually seek to implore Jesus' saving gaze: for all those who bear responsibility in the Church; for all suffering due to the turmoil of our times; for people great and small. Lord, continually envelop us with your gaze, lift us from all falls, and take us into your good hands.

rosaryMysteries.title: The Transfiguration on Mount Tabor
rosaryMysteries.mdText: Only where God is seen does real life truly begin. We are not the random and meaningless products of evolution. Each of us is the result of a thought of God. Each of us is wanted, each is loved, each is necessary. There is nothing more beautiful than to be reached, surprised by the Gospel, by Christ.

rosaryMysteries.title: The Institution of the Eucharist
rosaryMysteries.mdText: Union with Christ is at the same time union with all those to whom He gives Himself. I cannot possess Christ just for myself; I can belong to Him only together with all those who have become or will become His.

rosaryMysteries.title: The Agony of Jesus in the Garden
The Scourging of Jesus
The Crowning with Thorns
The Carrying of the Cross
The Crucifixion of Jesus
The Resurrection of Jesus
The Ascension of Jesus
The Descent of the Holy Spirit
The Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary
The Coronation of the Blessed Virgin Mary as Queen of Heaven and Earth
